result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing DECEMBER 15, 2015 received and filed. (16 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to LAW OFFICE OF FRANK J. SCHIRO.
Defendant Cynthia Corren Wright in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case called.  No action taken.

Attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Defense counsel advised the Court that the defendant is with her bedridden mother at the hospital.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 24.  Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Invoice forwarded to Accounts Payable in the amount of $437.50 to Dr Collins for services on 6/2,6/6, 68 of 2015 copy in file
Invoice forwarded to accounts payable in the amount of $625.00 to DR Jhon Pankiewicz for service on April-15,16,17,18-2015.Copy in file.

Defendant Cynthia Corren Wright in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for final pre-trial however, the parties have reached a resolution. Case called at 3:52pm and negotiations were placed on the record. Case passed.
Case recalled. Court ordered the jury trial date of 10/07/15 vacated.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 15CM1278 and 14CM4867 for the purposes of sentencing.  Status conference scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cynthia Corren Wright in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Parties are working on resolving this matter.  Court grants an additional adjournment for a final another final pretrial in Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Cynthia Corren Wright in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Parties do not challenge the report.  Defense requested a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
For Examination under 971.16 signed and filed.

Defendant Cynthia Corren Wright in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Doctor's Report Return hearing proceeded.  Defendant contests the findings of Dr. Pankiewicz.  Court appoints Dr. Collins from the Forensic Unit to conduct another examination.  Telephone call to Forensic Unit to schedule the appointment.  Defendant to report for examination on June 2, 2015 at 10:30 a.m.  Matter scheduled for Return on Doctor's Report.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cynthia Corren Wright in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense entered a plea of not guilty/not guilty by reason of mental disease/defect.  Court ordered the defendant to be examined by Dr. Pankiewicz.  The defendant has an appointment to be examined on April 16, 2015 at 9:00 am.  Court ordered case adjourned for for return on doctor's report in Branch 24.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cynthia Corren Wright in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense requested additional time to investigate and discuss matter further with defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-05-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Protasiewicz, Br.24.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty. Case is adjourned for a Status Conference in Branch 24.vb

Defendant Cynthia Corren Wright in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Cynthia Corren Wright not in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/20/15 @ 1:30pm
